content.description:
This is a bolted sport climb.

Per

James Hicks

: fun route, 6 bolts with a sporty finish. It shares the start with "Behind the Fridge," 5.10c. Left after the split is 5.10c, right is the 5.9.
content.location:
This starts on the 2nd set of bolts from the left but becomes the third route from the left after the split with

Behind The Fridge

.

content.description:
This route offers some nice crimps and felt a touch harder than its juggy and overhanging neighbor,

Jug Run

. See the

Jug Run is the bolt line immediately left to the aspen tree in this photo... it essentially follows the arc described by the tree. Pocket Protector is the longer route on the left.

for Jug Run, which includes Pocket Protector on the left.
content.protection: 6 bolts to a two-bolt anchor (the anchor is hidden from view at the base of the cliff but is farther on than the anchor for Jug Run).
content.location:
It is at the point where the trail that leads from the dirt road meets Team Wall, immediately to the left of

Jug Run

.

content.description:
This is a bolted sport climb.

Per

James Hicks

: 6 Bolts, located just left of the "Behind the Fridge" open book dihedral.
content.location: This is the 1st route on the left.

content.description: The name sums it up: a touch of slab down low leads to a fun route through a small roof/bulge section.
content.location: This is at the point where the trail that leads from the dirt road meets Team Wall.

content.description: This is a two move wonder boulder problem at the start followed by crimps and jugs.
content.location:
This is the right line of two 11a routes several feet right of

Jug Run

. From the top of the trail, go right about 20 feet.

content.description:
Just left of

Brown Cow

is Brown Chicken which is ~40 feet right of the trail intersection leading to the crag.

The crux is the open moves which is a two move wonder. Once past the first bolt, easier climbing leads to the anchor which is shared with

Brown Cow

.

This is the second route from the left and climbs the obvious clean dihedral up high.

Start up 5.9 slab for 3 bolts, veering left where

Rolling the Fridge

veers right.  Make funky moves on easier terrain around the corner to the left, then situate yourself for the crux past three more bolts.  A tricky stem will gain the second bolt in the dihedral, but it's not quite over for another couple moves!
